query.queryString: (/article/relations/categories/collection/code='resultsPack,projectsInfoPack,brief' OR (/result/relations/categories/collection/code='deliverable,publication' OR contenttype='project')) AND ('SUSTAINABILITY' OR 'INNOVATION' OR 'MULTI-CRITERIA')

warnings.message: One of the fields on which a sort was requested does not exist

result.title: NGI EU-US experimental platform ecosystem status report period 1
result.description: This report will contain a status of the NGI EU-US experimental platform ecosystem, including a consolidated report of the tangible outcomes of all the workshops of the NGI-EXP Board during the period. The report will also highlight the models for sustainability of the NGI-EXP Board. This report will be first produced at month 14 and an updated final version at month 24.

result.title: Report on stakeholder needs and research capacity needed
result.description: A report aligning the global modelling activities of PARIS REINFORCE with the Talanoa dialogue, starting from where we are in terms of knowledge (and knowledge gaps), in order to capture how stakeholders view where we want to go; and to finally outline how we can get there.

result.title: Report of models, tools and stakeholder knowledge
result.description: D2.1, associated with Task 2.1, will feature a detailed report with information on all models and tools, the information of which will also be available on the I2AM PARIS platform. This information will cover the regions, geographical extents, sectoral coverage, range of GHG emissions, mathematical foundations and structure, and main endogenous and exogenous parameters per model and main indicators, covering social, economic and ecological domains.

result.title: Interlinkages of global IAMs with the I2AM PARIS platform
result.description: This document will feature a report on the operational interlinkages established between the different modelling tools used in WP7, identifying key variables that can connect models through an input-output information exchange flow, ensuring full consistency across sector-specific, bottom-up, top-down modeling activities in PARIS REINFORCE.

result.title: Protocol for model use, scenarios and stakeholder engagement
result.description: D2.2 features a detailed protocol for organising the quantitative and qualitative work to be carried out in PARIS REINFORCE, including stakeholder engagement, scenario creation and use of models. The protocol will also define the modelling work and model inter-comparison exercises that will be undertaken, how the stakeholder engagement plan will be implemented and which tools will be applied to modelling outputs. It will also define which IAMs can be compared for each country or region and how the rest of the models can contribute to the overall exercise by providing more comprehensive information on issues related to the synergies and trade-offs of the Paris Agreement implementation.

result.title: Policy Briefing on What can ‘our models’ deliver
result.description: A detailed policy brief, outlining which policy questions have been addressed by each model in the past, who commissioned them, and who they were targeting, ii) a brief description of key modelling features, and iii) the level of transparency of the modelling exercise (assumptions, documentation, etc.).

result.title: Report on Project and Advisory Board Meetings
result.description: D1.2 features a periodic report of all (online and physical) project meetings (agendas, minutes, etc.). It also reports feedback from the Scientific Advisory Board, from electronic (e-mails, teleconferences, etc.) and physical (selected workshops to which they will be invited) communication. The deliverable will be initially submitted in Month 6, but will be constantly updated in Months 18 and 30.

result.title: Quality Management Plan
result.description: D1.1 will outline the envisaged actions from the Project Coordinator's and Quality Manager's side, as well as all WP leaders' side, to ensure that the project will run smoothly and that the deliverables will be of high quality and submitted on time. It will also describe in detail possible quality-relevant risks, which may manifest throughout the project, as well as the actions to mitigate these risks.

result.title: Project communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: A periodic report on the ways, in which our consortium can follow relevant research and novelties in the field and discover new approaches in what we are aiming to achieve through this project, as well as in which we can share the results so they are openly available and easily accessible. It will list different channels to reach the several target groups, such as preferred communication methods, a social media pack, relevant conferences where to meet them and raise their interest, identification of relevant media channels and synergies that could be created with other EU projects or networks. It will also include monitoring templates set for events, media work and others. This deliverable will be updated in Months 13 and 25.

result.title: Intinerant exhibition installed in first LAC venue
result.description: Itinerant Exhibition EU-LAC installed in first LAC venue. (MNA) For the traveling exhibition there will be a pack with common contents. The main body of the exhibition includes the branding and graphic design of the global project. Each partner will be asked to provide some audiovisual materials such as tablets, and to provide access to a wireless connection in order to ensure the interactivy with communities through our technological innovations.

result.title: Guidelines and recommendations based on a range of best practices for achieving societal and policy-maker engagement
result.description: These guidelines will explain the processes of (1) implementing the EU-Citizen.Science framework through already ongoing local activities and events and (2) achieving societal and policy-maker engagement within this framework. These guidelines will also provide instructions on how to start a new citizen science initiative and will be made available on the project platform.
